title: New 2020 Volkswagen Golf revealed – but will it live up to its predecessors?
text:
The new Volkswagen Golf was revealed this evening at Volkswagen’s headquarters in Wolfsburg.

Volkswagen has described the new model as the most technologically advanced Golf yet, and in-line with the current trend for electrification, the new model will feature several hybrid engine options, as well as a host of connectivity upgrades and a new, more technology-focused interior.

The new hybrid powertrains will consist of three petrol mild hybrids, of 109bhp, 129bhp, and 148bhp, and one petrol plug-in hybrid (PHEV), the 242bhp GTE. A 201bhp PHEV model, as well as Golfs powered by natural gas, will be made available abroad, though there are currently no plans to bring any of these to the UK.

If you don’t want a hybrid, you’ll be able to choose from two three-cylinder petrol engines, of 89bhp and 109bhp, and there’ll also be two four-cylinder diesels, in a sign that Volkswagen still has faith in the fuel despite declining sales, rated at 113bhp and 148bhp.

Inside, the Golf will feature a radically different interior dominated by a 10-inch touchscreen, which will come as standard on every model, as will a virtual instrument cluster that replaces the dials ahead of the driver with a second screen.
